meanings.definition: To announce or declare something formally or officially.
meanings.sent1: The principal annunciates the winner of the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: She always annunciates the rules before starting the game.
meanings.sent3: The parrot annunciates its hunger by squawking loudly.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun annunciates the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The town crier annunciates important news to the villagers.

meanings.definition: To make known or communicate something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher annunciates the upcoming test schedule to the students.
meanings.sent2: He annunciates his arrival by ringing the doorbell.
meanings.sent3: The cat annunciates its displeasure with a loud meow.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm annunciates its presence with booming thunder.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock annunciates the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: To proclaim or make a public declaration.
meanings.sent1: The president annunciates new policies during his speech.
meanings.sent2: The town crier annunciates the royal decree to the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The dog annunciates its excitement by wagging its tail vigorously.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks annunciates the beginning of the celebration.
meanings.sent5: The judge annunciates the verdict in the courtroom.
